title: no software update for s5 active

thread.text:
hi,
So everyone that has an s5 or active all have the new software update for the s5/active which is the marshmellow update and im the only one that doesnt have it.
My current software is 4.4.4 (Kitkat I think)
My data carrier is cricket btw.
Do any of you know why it's not updating?
Thanks!
-Eric

Welcome to Android Central! I moved this from the KitKat forum to the S5 Active forum, for more specific traffic.
You're not getting any official updates because the phone has to be on the original carrier's network to get them. Since the S5 Active was an AT&T exclusive, you'd have to get on AT&T's network. If it's important to you, you could consider buying a prepaid plan from AT&T for one month.
Hi, my dad's carrier is AT&T, do you know if I swapped the SIM card it would work?

It's worth a try! Which phone does he have? You need to make sure the SIM will fit in your phone. The S5 Active takes a microSIM, and most current phones take a nanoSIM, so you'd need an adapter to make it fit (which are cheap to get from Amazon or eBay).

Let's be clear: these kinds of popup warning that your phone has been "heavily damaged" by viruses are FAKE. They are popup ads associated with the website you're visiting, designed to scare you into thinking your phone is infected and then downloading some bogus "antivirus" app that is probably malware itself. If you ever get stuck on one of these popups, do the following:
1. Tap the Recent Apps button.
2. Swipe away the browser window.
3. Now reopen your browser, and avoid the website you were just visiting.
4. If you reopen the browser and it goes directly to that website, then exit out of the browser again, go to Settings>Apps, select the browser, and Clear Cache/Clear Data.

thread.text: Welcome to Android Central! Is it only happening when you visit certain sites, or does it happen on any site? Is this the stock Samsung "Internet" browser, or is it the version of Chrome that is preinstalled on more recent Samsung devices?

Got this same notification today on my Note 4, simply by accidentally touching a link which was on a legitimate website. I knew better than to follow the instructions in the message and followed some instructions on here in order to get rid of it. I did not need to uninstall chrome; simply went to settings > applications > application manager > chrome > force stop > storage > manage storage > clear all data. I then rebooted my phone (not sure I had to but figured, what the heck). After the reboot, I opened chrome and logged in. Don't forget you'll need to reset any of your settings within chrome as well; for example, I always keep data saver turned on and it was turned off by default after clearing the data. Anyhow, a pretty simple fix for what at first makes your heart jump into your throat!!!

No, this is not a real virus. The "Four Virus" is a simple scam that focuses on browsing history. For example, if you visit a 17+ site it will tell your personal data is exposed. Every time you get this message it will tell you to download an app. Do not follow these directions. To resolve the problem, turn on airplane mode. Next, clear your browsing data. After that you should be able to go online without these "warnings".

title: Sudden issues with Galaxy S5 Active SD card slot and music app

thread.text:
I'm just gone to take a shower, and then when I came back I had several problems with it all of the sudden;
- Would not read sd card
- Frequent soft locks, including when shutting down (the screen doesn't update but it still registers the visual touch cursor that I have enabled)
- Music app and soundalive kept crashing every 10 seconds after trying to open it
- When it didn't crash, I tried to play music on the device, it played for 2 seconds but then I heard a loud static noise, then neither the headphone jack nor the speakers can output audio
- Other apps crash too, but not with a message. Instead it just goes back to the lock screen
The card itself still works on another phone with a micro sd slot (thank god), and the headphones as well. Everything but the music app still seems to work, except I get interrupted by crash messages every 10 seconds so it's now practically useless
Possible reasons:
- Broken sd card slot causing errors. The sim slot directly underneath seems to still work. It's soldered onto the motherboard so a motherboard replacement may be needed if this is the problem
- Some sort of corruption in the music apk or elsewhere. I tried to uninstall updates and reinstall but it didn't work. I sure hope I don't need a factory reset to fix it, but I'm currently backing up everything just in case
Galaxy S5 Active, Android 6.0, not rooted

When you say the SD card works on another phone, do you mean that the music files play normally there?
Does the same problem happen in the S5 Active in Safe Mode? https://support.t-mobile.com/docs/DOC-28456

The fact that it works in Safe Mode suggests that some 3rd party app you installed is causing the instability. Unfortunately, there's no quick and easy way to pinpoint the culprit, unless you have some suspicion to begin with -- you may just have to uninstall apps one by one until the problem goes away.

The above was only a partial fix, the sd card still disconnects once a day, and restarting the phone in safe mode temporarily fixes it. The music app doesn't crash every 10 seconds

title: Samsung Galaxy S5 Active constantly dropping WiFi!

thread.text:
Hi all, I bought a brand new Galaxy S5 Active and it won't stay connected to WiFi. I could be standing next to the wireless router, my old S5 will show connected with Very Strong signal, my wife's iPhone, also shows connected. 
My S5 Active shows it will reconnect when the network improves, then it connects and shows a strong signal for a few minutes and then drops the connection. It keeps cyclin like this. Any suggestions? I have 3 weeks before I can return the phone.
Rich

Welcome to Android Central! Does this only happen on your home wi-fi network, or on any wi-fi? If it's only your home network, try rebooting your router by unplugging its power for 10 seconds. If that doesn't help, then see this guide for more tips: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...-problems.html

Thanks for the response. Why would I need to reboot the home router if my phone is the old one having the issue? I am just curious the reaaon.
That said, yesterday I dis not unplug the wireless router, but I did press the reset button. I will try to unplug and reboot if still an issue. I have read that it could be a router configuration issue. Seems odd that my S5 does not have the issue, only the S5 Active. 
So far, I haven't tried many other wifi networks other than at work since I just got the phone. It seems fine and fast at work. I also reseated the cards and battery, plus manually added the wfi network to my phone. I will see how it works tonight. I will try the router reboot next.
I saw mention of checking and changing the wifi channel. Is that changed on the router software itself?
How about the QOS setting. Is there a way to know if other devices are connected with priority?
Thanks!
Rich

replies.text:
It's very much possible for only one device to have difficulty connecting, while others have no problem. I don't know the technical reasons, but I know that a reboot of the router can fix it.
Changing the wi-fi channel is done through the router's settings, which can be accessed through your browser on your computer -- see the router's manual for more information.
QoS can sometimes cause isssues, but it's usually with data transmission speed -- QoS will prioritize certain connections (for media) and throttle the lower priority connections. That doesn't sound like the problem you're having.

Don't worry, I deleted the duplicate post.
Those Arris modem/routers can be a bit wonky -- I've had a few. But yes, it's worth trying a different wi-fi channel. You access the router's settings by entering the local IP address in your computer's browser -- it's usually the first address. So if your network is "192.168.0.xx", enter "192.168.0.1" in your browser, and you should see a login page (although I think Arris might tend to use 10.0.0.1). The username should be "admin" and if you've never accessed it before, the password should be either blank or "password."
Once in the settings, you can look in the wi-fi settings for the option to change the wi-fi channel. You may want to use an app like Wi-fi Analyzer to see which channels are least congested. Also, in the router's settings, make sure the DHCP range is wide enough to accommodate all of your devices (i.e., it should be something like 192.168.0.1 to 192.168.0.255).

replies.text: You can find your computer's local IP address by going to this website: https://www.whatismybrowser.com/dete...cal-ip-address. Take that address, and replace the last digit with "1", and that should be the router's address. Entering the router's IP address into your browser's URL bar is the standard way of accessing the router's settings. It works for other devices too, like a wireless printer.Install the app on your phone, not the computer.This could be due to variations in nearby wi-fi congestion, so changing the wi-fi channel still might help.Are the system updates being pushed to the phone over-the-air? If your web connection is unstable, it might be interfering with the update process. Try bringing the phone to your local library or coffeehouse and use their free wi-fi to download the update. Also try wiping the cache partition, which won't erase any personal data: https://support.t-mobile.com/docs/DOC-28492

I found a ton of settings, but not the dhcp..range.
I am installing acrylic wifi analyzer. I guess I use the tool and which ever channel is most open...use that?
So far the Analyzer just says that no router is connext ed to the PC. Weird???
I noticed my phone looks different than our other devices. 
All our devices have a personalized name...like my daughter'S iPhone shows up as Kacey's iphone.
Mine shows up as android with a huge number. 
I don't know if that has an impact?
Another weird thing...all other devices connected have a high RSS Level number, such as -50 dBm. But my Android is -35 dBm.
Sorry, I just you said to use the wifi analyzer on my phone. I will.
Can I just do the software update over cellular network and skip wifi? I think I got it downloaded and now that I cleared space, I want to run it again. Does the software update stor on my phone where I can rerun the install?

I realized that it must be the RSSI signal strength. 
Changing channels won't fix that???
If I am right next to the router, my rssi is 43....while my wife can be far away in a bedroom and have an rssi of 50. 
Why, any idea?

Hi again, you were a big help. I think we got it resolved.
Your suggestion to check the administrators..tool and I noticed my phone had a weak signal. Oddly only my samsung devices suffered. The Apple products stayed pretty strong. I then contacted Xfinity and they said I may have too many devices connected. I hadn't even thought of that. I then shut down my old S5, not even realizing it was on wifi and eating bandwidth for nothing. I turned it off and also for the heck of it deleted any old unconnected devices m the router. I noticed my signal bumped up to 56...and then staying between 50 and 60 or more. I believe the issue is resolved. Interesting how only the Samsung phones were fighting for bandwidth.
I also told my wife and daughter to try to keep devices like the iPad and tablet or note, disconnected when not in use. 
Thanks bro!

So the problem came up again....
And I swapped out the router for a new one from Xfinity and now it is fine. The connection is strong and no drops.

title: Galaxy S5 Active and Xfinity WiFi issues!

thread.text:
Hi all! I am so frustrated.
I bought a new Galaxy S5 Active (not refurbished) about 5 weeks ago. Ever since then, I have had issues with my home Xfinity/Comcast WiFi network. When I bought the phone, I did a transfer of data from my old phone and had issues with upgrading to the new software version. I used the ATT&T Transfer app and it hung for hours and I had to manually stop it. Weird. So, I took the phone to a Samsung Tech at Best Buy, and they were able to force the upgrade. I wonder if I should have done a Factory Reset from day one??? So it had initial problems, transferring data and upgrading.
I use an Xfinity Arris TG862G.
Anyway, we have a home Xfinity WiFi network. I guess the router is at least 2 years old, maybe older. Not always, but most of the time, my phone shows up as a very weak connection. In fact, when this all started, I noticed having my old phone on the network, I assumed was taking up too much bandwidth because when I shut it down, my new phone suddenly connected great! Then after that software upgrade, it continued great for a few weeks. Now, it is always strong and solid with WiFi out of our home, and works well on all WiFi networks except our home Xfinity network. We have about 5 other Apple devices that all connect well, at about 50-60 db (RSSI level), but my phone maintains about a 20 - 35 db connection strength. All other phones on the network are fine. Once in a while it connects great and jumps up to 50+, but most of the time, it has issues connecting, horrible performance and continues to drop the connection. I installed some WiFi tools, signal boosters that help a little. In addition to the weak connection and internet hanging all the time, I am not getting Authentication Error like every 20 minutes or so, and I have to reconnect. It keeps happening, and only on the home network. 
Why only my phone and my home WiFi router? Its an Arris unit. I have tried checking the Ghz setting but I think the modem/router is 2.4Ghz only. I have done Wireless router resets, unplugged it, restarted it, rest my Galaxy by removing batter and cards, manually connecting to the WiFi network, cleared cache, etc. I have NOT done a Factory Reset yet, and may do that tonight. Maybe I should have done that from day one?! But still, why only my home network? 
Another weird thing is that when I use Samsung Smart Switch on my laptop to backup my phone, the Smart Switch app is unable to recognize my phone! So, I can't back it up! Ugh!
I bought the phone from Gadget Wizards online, new, and they have great customer service. They said I can return it, but it seems weird why this is isolated to my phone and Xifinity WiFi.
Thoughts? Do a reset? Any setting I should check? WiFi hotspot setting? Funy when I read troubleshooting tips online, they point to menu settings that I do not have on my phone. Weird?!
Thanks! I appreciate it!
See if the wi-fi channel your router is using is congested. If so, change the channel. See this guide for more details: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...-problems.html

I forgot to mention that I read of people changing their Xfinity router/modem from 10.0.0.1 to a 198 number?
Thanks regarding the signal congestion. That is interesting because that is how I fixed it when I got the phone. I removed my old phone from the line and then I connected fine. AND, this is hit or miss, last night was pretty good. I notice when I am the only one in the house on wifi, I don't seem to have the problem, but not always, it can still happen! 
But, why would this only always effect my Galaxy and never effect any of our other devices?!
Can I analyze to see the least congested channel? 
It is frustrating that many of the items on that troubleshooting list, do not seem to apply to my phone. For example, many of the Advanced options.
Question about Date and Time? On number 9.
9. Make sure your date and time are correct. Check the Settings>Date & Time menu, and make sure "Automatic Date & Time" and "Automatic Time Zone" (if available) are checked. If there is a discrepancy between your device's date and time and that of the router, the connection may not work.
I noticed my Galaxy did not have Automatic date and time, nor Automatic time zone checked! Could that really cause a connection issue? I mean, the time is correct either way. But wouldn't this cause issues with all wifi networks and not just my Xfinity network at home?
In Advanced I also unchecked Hotspot 2.0 and Auto connect to AT&T WiFi Hotspots.
Thanks!

You can use an app like Wi-fi Analyzer to see what the local wi-fi channel usage is like.
Did you also see if your DHCP range is wide enough? If you limited it at some point, it's possible that your network might be reaching the maximum number of allowable connected devices.

title: Color of roads in Google Maps

thread.text: I have version 9.95.0 of Google Maps. Suddenly the route adjacent to the BLue route I was using, a green road showed up next to the road I was traveling on. What's the significance of a GREEN road. Thanks.

That's usually traffic conditions. Blue is the 'normal' color or no-info-available one, but if you activate the Traffic Layer, you'll see a gradient between green (OK), yellow/orange (slower-than-average traffic), and red (slow/stopped traffic).
I've been using Google maps for 3 years now and I have never seen a green road. I have TRAFFIC on each time I use the map.

I think I misunderstood you then... you're talking about green roads WHILE navigating (turn-by-turn navigation), right? In that case I think the green road means that an alternate route was available while you were traveling and you are on the best route. However, since I'm not navigating at the moment I can't confirm that's true or not (I usually don't look at the map, just use the voice directions). 
Has it happened again since? Is there anything special/specific about that road (restricted access or near a toll or something)? Or was it at the beginning/end of the trip?
Thanks. It was near the end of the trip.
I'll keep an eye of it now

title: What are the benefits of jailbreaking my new Galaxy S5 Active?

thread.text: things might be changing here soon

Benefits, :the freedom to customise to your hearts content. To control the clock speed of the processor, to kill apps you don't want.... Loads of fun
Get the latest version of software 
Risks : you could brick the device. Open it to malware. 
You may not get security patches.. 
It may become buggy and unreliable.. 
These are just a few, do your research well and back up all, so you can come back to stock if you need to.

First, "jailbreaking" is a term used with iPhones. With Android phones, you root the ROM - that's just basically adding the file su to one folder.
It allows you superuser access to the operating system that Android is running on (Linux), which allows you to do just about anything - including removing all the files from the phone, turning it into a hand warmer, so I'd advice that you read a lot more about rooted phones before trying it.
It also prevents you from getting any updates (including security patches, but also newer versions of Android, and an S5 may still be lacking the latest version).
Once you root it, even if you revert it to stock, there may still be signs left, and the warranty will be voided.

title: Can't play music on my S5-Active

thread.text:
I’m having issues with sound on my android phone. 
History: Had an iPhone 3gs and put a lot of music on it. I acquired a Samsung S5 and tried to move the music which spent a bit of time on a Windows 10 machine. When I try to play the music on the Samsung phone with the default player I will simply get a statement “Cannot play this format” or some such thing. Seems like all my files are WMA files. I’m reasonably sure when I originally copied them from my own CDs they were MP3. I go to the Play Store and get a conversion program to get them into MP3 format and it doesn’t work as all the files are DRM protected. I cannot remove the DRM protection. I have no idea where the DRM came from. I’ve tried several of the music players found on Play Store, several of which claim to be WMA compatible and they do not work. When I try to listen I hear random chirps of sound, nothing identifiable as music.
Now what? I’ve got something like 65 CDs worth of music I’d love to get on my Samsung. Any ideas? I do have access to a laptop running Ubuntu if that would help.

Unfortunately, we won't be able to advise you on how to get around DRM, no matter how it became associated with the files.
Do you still have all of the CDs? If so, rip them again and copy the new files over. If you don't have the CDs any more, do you have the original ripped files on your computer, or were they only stored on the iPhone? Did you originally rip them with iTunes or WMP? I'd assume you used iTunes since you had an iPhone, but there's no way iTunes would've ripped them into WMA files.

title: 3 Questions About My S5

thread.text:
Howdy all,
I own an unlocked, AT&T Samsung Galaxy S5 that is running Marshmallow (6.0.1) and my provider is Tracfone. I have a handful of questions about it and about smart phones running the Android O/S. I'm a semi-retired IT Geek and my system runs Linux (Ubuntu 16.10 with GNOME at present) so I'm not entirely clueless, but at the same time, when it comes to the Android O/S and smart phones as a class of technology, I'm still pretty green. I'm hoping all of you can help me fix that shortcoming! I'll keep the questions as brief as possible. BTW - the model number of my S5 is: SM-G900A.
1) The phone still is using the same 2800 mAh Lithium Ion battery it came with. It really needs to be replaced, but... As an interim solution, I picked up a 50,000 mAh battery pack. It works fine, but it has both a 1 and a 2 Amp port. Looking at the charger that came with the phone, it states that its output is 1.1 Amps. My question is: Can I safely connect my phone to the 2 Amp port to charge it, or not?
2) As I carry the phone around with me, either in a hip pocket or in my shirt pocket, when I bring it out to use it, it seems to have launched at least one and sometimes more than one app. The only thing I can figure out is that the AMOLED touch screen is so sensitive, riding around in my pocket is sufficient to activate it (which is funny in a way b/c there have been times when I try to make it do something and I practically have to beat on it before it does more than just smirk at me!). My question: WHAT can be done to DECREASE the sensitivity of the touch screen beyond using the phone's settings? Alternatively, is there some method by which you can suspend the phone's actions except for receiving calls/texts, etc?
3) FINALLY (for now) , I connect my phone to my computer when I'm at home to a - charge it and b - upload files to and download files from it. Occasionally, I will go exploring inside the phone using my computer's file manager (Nautilus). What's odd is that there appear to be a large number of directories especially within the phone's memory, that are completely empty (or do they just appear to be empty?). That's my last question for now: Is there a way that I can have complete access to the data in my phone's memory as well as on the SD Card I have installed in it? Before you suggest that I root my phone, I tried that with a couple of previous phones and got mixed results at best. In one case, I 'bricked' the phone and that did not make me at all happy!
That's enough for now (I'm sure you all agree as well!). I do appreciate the help you can provide for me in learning the 'facts of life' about smart phones!

1. Yes it's OK to use the 2A port. Theoretically with a 2800mAh battery if you had a 2.8A charger that would still be OK (1A = 1000mA). And actually if you had a charging device that can supply up to 4A you'd still be OK as your S5 is only going to be pulling in what it needs. Also, while your battery is charging it will initially start to require a higher number of amperage and then it gradually fades as it gets charged up -- so (completely made up numbers here) if your battery is at 45% when you plug it in to get charged it might pull in 1950mA but by the time it's close to done, say 98% it might only be pulling in 100mA.
2. No comment on what you're asking specifically. I use a phone holster with a belt clip. Some view them as silly or geeky-looking but I prefer it because I never have to worry about what pocket to use or leaving my phone on a table somewhere, it's always in the same place on my hip. Plus with my phone not being in any pocket there's less of a chance inadvertent contact with the screen will be an issue.
3. Not quite sure which directories you're referring to, but running a Linux system (also a Linux user, Slackware since 2003) does allow you to access more things with less friction than say a Windows box. There's a basic file manager that Samsung includes, look for the 'My Files' app in your Apps menu, and be sure to go into its Settings menu and check off the boxes for 'Show hidden files' and 'Show file extension'. Using My Files go into some of those directories in question and see if they're still empty, or not.

Thank you VERY much for your reply to my questions! I'm sorry that it took me this long to return and acknowledge your response. 
I too use a holster for my S5. One that actually has a belt loop since I have had bad luck with the holster and phone getting detached from my belt and going MIA. Even so, using my holster (which fits very snugly around the phone by design), I have pulled the phone out to find applications open and I cannot account for how that happened. However, my index of suspicion is high that somehow pressure was applied to the touchscreen in such a manner that the phone thought I wanted the offending application to be opened.
I think that the answer to this issue is to A) shorten the length of time the display is active without input and/or B) Discover how to lock the phone's display immediately before stowing it.
To answer your question about my third question: I wish to have unrestricted access to ALL of the files on my phone. Not because I have any desire to tinker with them unnecessarily, but on the general principle that it is MY phone and I insist on the right to have access to ALL of the information it contains - ALL the information. When it comes to the O/S, I'm sure that Google would take exception to my point of view, but FWIW Google can go straight to Hell and right along with the horse they rode in on! "Don't Be Evil" my a**! 
And closely related to my desire to have unfettered access to all the data contained on my phone is the crapware installed on it as a consequence of being associated with AT&T. I would gladly give a buffalo nickel (if I had one to give!) to be given directions on how to remove these applications from my phone. I have all of them turned off or otherwise disabled, I would just as soon not have them taking up any of the measly 16GB of memory my S5 has, Likewise with the crapware installed by Google, although I grudgingly acknowledge that some of them may be unavoidable unless I want to get root access and replace the O/S and everything else. As I said previously, I'm just not willing to go that route....not yet at any rate!
I did appreciate the insight about the built in file manager. When I opened it, I found that the show hidden files feature was not enabled, so I enabled it, however I have not had the time yet to go surfing around in my phone yet through Nautilus. Hopefully I will this weekend. Happy Friday, BTW! 
Thanks again,
Frank

Imagine I text someone new at 930pm. When I text them, a line above the text shows the date with the format: day (mon, tue, etc), mm/dd/yyyy. Then inside the message it has actual time for that day.

title: How do I move it back to internal storage from SD on my S5 active?

thread.text: I moved an app to SD card to free up some space, and now I have more room and would like to move it back to internal storage. I have tried many things and it does not give me the option to move it back to internal storage.

If you don't want to use Drop Box or Googe Drive to upload files, and then download them to your phone, you can buy a thumb drive with both a micro USB plug, the same that you use to insert a charger cord into the phone. Insert it into the phone with the SD card and copy/move your SD card files onto that thumb drive. Now move the thumb drive from your SD card phone, and insert it into the Note 5 charger input. Go to the Samsung (Google?) "My Files" app, find the newly downloaded files you want and copy/move them onto your Note 5.

title: Why Does my S5 Active Think it Has no Storage Left on the Phone?

thread.text:
I have an s5 active, which I have been using in airplane mode only for the last 8 months, I haven't downloaded any new apps except one news reader, crossword puzzle, hexic2048, Lookout and WhatsApp. 
I tried downloading my gmail emails and it told me I have no space left on my phone. 
Hooked my phone up to my computer to look at the file structure. It tells me that I have only 328mb left on the phone. 
However when I go into the phone (when I open the phone folder structure, as opposed to the memory card folders), and I right click on the sumtotal of all files, it tells me that I only have 52.8mb used. 
I planned on manually transferring the files from the phone to the memory card or to my computer once it was hooked up, but this makes no sense. 
Is this...I dunno...a virus that's tricking my phone into thinking its running out of space? 
I am not very familiar with Android file systems. I do know Windows. It's probably likely that I am not looking in the correct folder for the bulk of the data that is taking up all the space on my phone.

I don't think it's a virus. Probably an app mis reporting storage use. I would suggest this, pull any media you want to keep from the phone and delete that. That might free up more space than you realize.
Can you show a screenshot of the storage stats, too please?

title: S5 Active (dust behind screen blocking camera)

thread.text: I have a galaxy s5 Active. Even though the phone is supposed to be water and dust proof, somehow it got dust behind the screen blocking the front camera making front pictures fuzzy. Is there anything I can do? I went to repair stores and said they aren't able to fix this.

replies.text:
They are not "proof" anything... they are "resistant", which means water and dust can still get in. You'll probably have to have the screen removed to get at the dust. Doing so may damage the screen in the process. Even if you call Samsung, I doubt they'll take care of the problem without charging you money. As for the repair shop, they probably just didn't want to take the job of removing the dust (and possibly damaging the screen in the process)... I'm sure they'll fix it for you if you buy an entire new screen from them.
Given the option of replacing the screen just for some dust, I would start gently tapping the phone in the corner somewhere to see if the dust can be moved enough to clear the lens.

Custom generally voids the warranty. (It depends on how knowledgeable the person you're talking to is, and which carrier you're on.) It has nothing to do with developer options, it means that the ROM isn't stock. A bad update (they don't always work over the air - it's a known [by those who code things like over the air updates] design flaw in the Android update process) could cause it.
Either live with it (the next update could fix it) or see if your carrier will at least reflash the ROM.

Okay. Paul, you say you do this for a living and hopes are being lost that you are going to get back with us with any information. After all, it's been six months since you said you would look into it.
To those of you that have this problem. The news gets worse. At least for me it did. I made the mistake of not having insurance. Warranty is up as far as I know. Phone is over a year old. Mine started one day in the car....my wife was driving...it's okay. My phone was sitting between us. I looked down and saw that my phone had gone into a download mode. Said it was DOWNLOADING. I know what downloading is, but never saw this screen before. So I left it going as it instructed to not disconnect the phone...disconnect from what....the battery? Anyway, the car ride was about another 40 minutes and the phone was still on this screen....Big ugly android guy that was downloading something. Well, we stayed at my in-laws for a few hours and left. My phone was still in that mode. I decided to wait until I got home. I was so worried that, if I pulled the battery, the phone was going to be ruined. After the long ride home, I get inside the house and decide to just pull the battery and restart. Luckily the phone booted just fine. But, over these last few months, my phone continued to do this. Would be using the phone and suddenly it would go to that big ugly guy again and telling me it was downloading. 15 or 20 minutes later I would pull the battery and all was fine. After a while I would just pull the batter immediately after seeing that ugly droid. Then my phone in the last 4 or 5 weeks started restarting. I could be in the middle of typing a text message and it would just reboot. I started searching online for others with this problem and saw things about the "CUSTOM" word showing up. I checked on mine as it went through this process and, guess what, mine said it was CUSTOM. Brand new phone, never had anything done to other than download a few games from the Play Store. Then about a week and a half ago, my phone would only boot to a screen that told me that my phone will not boot because there had been something done to it that was not supposed to be done and to contact....either my carrier or Samsung....can't remember which. Now today, the phone threw me for a complete loop....literally. It boots to the Samsung screen, shuts off, turns itself back on, boots to the Samsung screen, shuts off, turns itself back on, boots to the Samsung screen, shuts off, turns itself...you get the picture. Now, my phone is the Note 4 with T-Mobile as my carrier. I'm thinking of chatting with T-Mobile or possibly Samsung, but I'm certain they will tell me that my phone had the rooting or custom system put on it or one of these things that people keep saying must have been what caused it. What caused it was a faulty phone that is almost 2 years old. Was brand new from T-Mobile and never had any customization done. So I would assume that some of you with this problem will eventually come into some, if not all, of the problems I have and will be out of a phone that cost you almost $800. Well, that's what I paid for it over a year ago. So if anyone....PAUL....really does do this for a living, or has come up with a solution, please enlighten us with this solution.
Thank you.

Reflash the stock ROM - see [Samsung] How to flash Stock ROM via ODIN. Be prepared to die of boredom if you don't have something to do. Setting up the flash takes a couple of minutes - then it can be 10 minutes before the phone is flashed, restarted and ready to go. And you're just looking at what's as about as exciting as grass growing in the winter.
You'll lose all your downloaded apps and all your data (pictures, videos, music, etc.) because you can't get the phone to the point that you can back it up (unless you always kept it backed up).

I just recently had the same problem of my phone turning off and on over and over until I took out the battery. This was after weeks of my battery draining at a rate of 10% every 15 minutes. I thought my battery had gone bad so I bought a new one. However, I never had the Downloading message.
Then I noticed the Custom message with the open padlock. I have no idea how long that had been there because I don't watch my phone that closely when restarting. I had never rooted my phone and don't download many apps but assumed somehow my phone had been compromised. title: Charging Cable

Have you tried any other USB cables, regardless of them being OEM or not? If the same thing happens with other cables, then it's probably the port. If other cables work fine, then there's probably a loose connection or frayed wires within your cable.

Or when you are actively charging using the original cable or the car charger, do they usually sit in a way such that the cable is kinked near where it plugs into the phone?

title: Annoying Screen Awake/Sleep Sound

thread.text:
Hey there. Have an active on the telus network, think it's 4.4.2. Last week out of the blue, whenever I put my screen to sleep using the side button, a weird little "blurp" sound chimes in. Then when I wake the screen, enter my code, and putz around for 2-3 seconds, it chimes in again. I have tried everything I know to turn it off, but it is still there. Any ideas? If I turn off all sound it goes away, but that's all I can do. Help!
Posted via the Android Central App
It should be an option in Sounds and Notifications (under 'Other Sounds'). Make sure SCREEN LOCK SOUND is checked off.

Yeah. Checked that. It is off. The only thing I have checked is haptic feedback. Even when I turn it off it still makes that sound.
Posted via the Android Central App
This might sound odd, but have you tried turning it on, and then back off?
Just tried that. Sorry to report, it did not work.
Haha. When I turned it on. It played 2 different sounds, the one I'm trying to get rid of then the one that is stock on the phone when you enable that screen lock sound. WTF. Lol

OK, so we're getting somewhere then. You have two DIFFERENT sounds. That means the lockscreen sound is not coming from the system. Do you have any apps that might be controlling lockscreens or notifications?
What about if you enter your phone in safe mode (no 3rd party apps should run at boot), does it do it?
Ok. Just entered safe mode. 5 seconds after I wake screen, that same sound! Grrrrr. Take it out of safe mode, 5 sec nods after I enter my code, same sound. 🔫
Dang it! So it's not an app...
I know. It's so frustrating...
I think I found it. When I pull down to my notification panel, and turn off "location", it goes away. So far
The phone itself keeps changing my location mode from "power saving" to "high accuracy" too. Weird
If I go to "GPS only", the sound goes away.
So it's related to Location Services? And you didn't update anything? That's so odd!! Might want to try factory-resetting your phone, but still weird that it's happening out of the blue!
Yup. 100% location services. No updates at all. I'm still waiting for lollipop for the active, and my carrier hasn't updated in a long time. No idea why GPS only gets rid of it. But it does.

replies.text: For me on my s7 it was all about nfc.
For me it was the nfc too. Note4
NFC here too. It just started out of nothing! Nexus 5 Android 6.0.1.

thread.text:
Can you solve the problem?
I have the same problem
I have also suffering the same problem. Please help me how to solve it.

I think, i find it.
This is the location_changed.ogg in Transparent clock & weather APK.
In transparent clock and weather I turned off the 'play a sound when location changes' and this stopped the sound. You can leave the location service on.

Thank you so much for posting this. Brand new phone, have been testing out different weather apps and lots of other stuff all at once, and could not figure out where this annoying sound was coming from. Was driving me mad. You're a lifesaver.

many thanks!

title: No sound for 1st 30 seconds when making outgoing calls.

thread.text: Quite often when I make outgoing calls on my S5 Active, I can't hear anything for the first 30 to 35 seconds and then the volume kicks in. The people on the other end can hear me. It only seems to happen when I'm not using bluetooth. I have tried turning bluetooth off, many reboots, and a full master reset. It only seems to happen since upgrading to Marshmallow. I have it connected to my Gear fit most of the time but I don't think that does anything since I've tested it without it connected. Incoming calls are always fine. I suspect an app might be interfering but not sure. Occassionally when I try to hang up after it has been attempting to make a call, it 'hangs' and does not respond and then sometimes reboots. Also happens when I am in 'Safe' mode. Anyone have any suggestions?
It sounds like corruption, either in the ROM or in the hardware it's sitting in. It needs to go to a shop.
Thx. I was thinking of downgrading to 5.0 and starting again. If that doesn't work, I guess I'll take it in or just get a new one.

So I think I may have figured it out. After resetting it a couple times, it would work for a day or so and then the issue would start happening again. If I made an outgoing call and immediately switched to speakerphone, it would work. If I made a normal call without switching to speakerphone, the call would go through but I couldn't hear anything for at least 30 seconds or longer. Sometimes it would 'hang' if I tried to end the call and occasionally reboot. I reflashed the firmware using Kies and once again, the problem popped up after 2 days. I turned of the "OK Google" detection feature in Google Now and that seems to have solved the issue. I'll update this if the problem persists.

title: I can't change my lock screen security option S5

thread.text:
So I went to unlock my phone that had a pattern and it did not recognize it even though I entered it correctly 10 times. It asked for my backup pin and I entered it correctly, again 100% it was not wrong. It kept adding seconds to my log in timer. This has been happening every couple days for the past week. I just restart my phone and the pattern is recognized. Anyway, today I unlocked my phone with my google account and then I went to change my security screen to the same pattern to see if it would stop bothering me every couple days. Then, I noticed that even after I chose my pattern it would revert to swipe, no security. After re doing the pattern a couple of times and still staying at swipe no security (I turned off my phone and there was no pattern even though every time I wanted to switch the security screen it would ask me for the pattern). I switched to pin. That did not work and stayed at swipe no security and as I tried to change it, it asked me for the pin. I entered it and it said sorry, try again. So now I can't change the screen lock. What do I do? My lock screen is unlocked by a swipe even though in the settings for security it says pin.
HELP!!!
I've restarted it many times and I don't want to do a factory reset because I have too many pictures and contacts that I cannot afford to lose.

Welcome to Android Central! Moved to the S5 forum (initially posted in the S5 Active forum by mistake).
I've seen this issue crop up with some regularity here, but not quite sure why it happens and how to solve it. If you go to Android Device Manager on the web and try to remotely lock the phone with a new password, does it let you do it?
I have not tried it but I will do it now. One second and thanks for the response.
Thank you soo much! It worked. I can now go to settings and change the lock option! Is there any way to upvote your response or add reputation to your account?

Wow, I actually didn't think that'd work! Most of the time in these situations, ADM says a new password isn't needed because the phone already has a password -- this is because most people try this when they have forgotten (or "forgotten") their original phone password. The ADM remote lock/password only works if the phone isn't secured with a lock in the first place. I guess since your phone was stuck on swipe only, that means it didn't have a lock in place, which is why ADM did work.
We have no upvoting or reputation, just the Like button. No need for any of that -- I'm just glad the problem was solved!
I've found a solution check out my video

title: Sd card issues after phone update

thread.text:
Hi. I have a galaxy s5 active on att. A few weeks ago my phone updated and ever since done of my programs haven't been able to read the sd card. It's not all of them though, mainly the music player (mortplayer) and book reader (moon+ reader) that i was using. Other programs have no problem reading it and it shows up in settings. How can i fix this? The reader wasn't a big deal, i just moved the books to the phone but i have way too much music to do that with that. In the meantime I've downloaded some other music players which are able to read the card but i don't like then nearly as much as mort. I'd really like to get that working again. Anyone have any ideas how to do this? 
Thanks

Welcome to Android Central! Go to the App Manager, select your music app, and tap Permissions. Make sure it has permission to access the SD card.
Also, your issue sounds like it might be related to this: http://forums.androidcentral.com/sam...ml#post5448735

Have you tried going to the App Manager, selecting MortPlayer or Moon+ Reader, and Clearing Cache/Data?

Not sure what would happen if i moved it back to the phone. And for the book reader i just moved the books to the phone since they don't take up much space. So I've got the two main things that were giving me a problem working, but it's just bandaids, it doesn't address the root issue. :/

title: Rooting a Samsung Galaxy S5 Active

thread.text:
Anyone Root a Samsung S5 Active ? ... if so what did you use ? and how did it go ?
I recently purchased a Samsung Galaxy S5 Active (unlocked) which was originally distributed by AT&T... after swapping the SIM card from my old phone I am now using it on another network and everything works fine... However, I would very much like to get rid of all of the Bloatware and AT&T apps (all of which in std mode is not possible)... hence my interest in Rooting the phone (an activity I have not previously done)... the first (2) "One Click Root" and "King Root" indicated that they did not support Rooting my phone/OS/Build (not sure which part)... 
i.e. my S5 Active is:
Samsung SM-G870A
Android ver. 5.0
Build #: LRX21T.G870AUCU2B0F2

From what I have read over the past 2 months the only way was if you didn't let it update from 4.4.2 kitkat when you first turned it on. Now that it has version 5.x you are screwed. I am in the same boat as you. Bought my phone from amazon 2 months ago. Didn't know a thing about rooting , roms, nothing,...was upgrading from a 2009 garmin phone. pulled my old mini sim from that phone, with at&t, trimmed it down to micro sim size and slapped it in the new phone, boom, no contract, new phone, same plan...good to go. 2 days later it starts downloading updates from at&t, I was like cool....maybe it will update itself all the way to marshmallow.....nope. stopped at 5.1.1 and I dislike the white blinding white back grounds when you go into settings. no way to fix it either, none that I can find. So far I've inverted colors to black, under the vision settings option. tried a bunch of free crap on the g, play app store but nothing changes the settings background. I'm stuck with it. One trick I did find to do about the bloat ware was to disable all of them, and set them to never update, ever. I had to factory reset the phone 4 times though before I learned how to do that. the key is to keep it off of wifi until you lsolate and lock down all those apps before you let it connect for the first time. It's like trying to pin down a virus. So, I'm only running ccleaner, firefox,google play services,googleplay store,Lookout,and translate as active apps on this phone so far. everything else is disabled. mobile data stays off. gps stays off, everything I can think of is shut off and not allowed to update itself. I managed to free up 9.67gb of available space on the core storage and I just added a 32 gb sd card. Before with all the bloatware updating and running there was only 6gigs free on the phone. This is the best I can do. Maybe someone else can chime in if they have a better solution. I see canada s5 actives are running 6.x software....maybe at&t will get with the program....and push it to us.
DD

Thanks... appreciate the feedback... and yeah... have walked pretty much the same path other than am on 5.0... have also disabled all my AT&T stuff as well... but would love to give it as well as a bunch more the heave ho... BS that they lock this crap up... I mean are these our phones or what ? sheesh...

After looking a bit more I found this site which seems to offer the possibility of a work around... anyone have any thoughts on this route ?How to Downgrade Firmware on AT&Ts S5 A… | Samsung Galaxy S 5

replies.text: It don't work I've had the s5 active since 2014 and am on 5.1 and can assure you anything posted before 2016 does not work, there is a way for 5.0 I've came across it in search of hope for root on my 5.1 and it's possible maybe on the xda forums or even on comments of that xda post there is new instructions, but there is a way I've seen for 5.0 just stick with xda they know what they are doing and if possible it's on their forums, I'm not smart about root or phones by any means but I've spent 2 and some change in years researching and losing root gaining root and losing again on my active and love the phone hate the bootloader locked BS but I do know about our s5s, all I can say is research and only trusted places as XDA and if like me and not the smartest on this subject stick with XDA ONLY they won't sell ya bad info, good people there and trusted

title: What kind of Micro SD cards are compatible with my S5 active?

thread.text: My phone works great, it just needs more storage space. I want to make sure I'm purchasing the right kind/brand. I would like to assume that any samsung brand micro SD's would work, but I'm not sure.
I'd check at Best Buy or on Amazon. I've always had good luck with Samsung or SanDisk.
I've used the samsung with really good results.
Just wondering how large a card our phones will accept? GSM arena states 256gb microSD. Just wondering if anyone has gone bigger. Issues?

Any of the Samsung or Sandisk MicroSD cards will work just fine. However, I would not recommend using anything above a 128GB because the S5 Active really can't take advantage of the higher capacities with it's capabilities and cannot read/write the cards as fast as the newer phones. Unless you're shooting a ton of 4K video or you use the phone as a portable media player for movies/music, you really don't need anything beyond a 32GB card.

title: Samsung Internet

thread.text: Does anyone actually use this? If so what are the benefits that differ from Google, Google Chrome or Firefox?

The only advantage would be that it syncs up to your Samsung Account (but Chrome also has account sync), it integrates with TouchWiz to share links, Drag-Drop, search, S-Voice etc. (which the others don't), and if you have the updated version, supports ad blockers (which Chrome currently doesn't, but other browsers are starting to, too).
It is a pretty snappy browser.

title: Why lollipop use huge amount of ram ?

thread.text:
Hello everyone. I have Samsung Galaxy S5 Active and upgraded to Android 5.1.1 Lollipop. But I check in setting at Running apps, there is showed 'system' use 1gb of ram. What's wrong with that ?? Any solution to fix this problem ?? I really need help here.  Please answer Okay. Sorry for my bad english
Thank you

Welcome to the forums. Something to keep in mind is Android does not use RAM like a Windows PC does. Android prefers to have RAM full to make app switching more fluid and easier on the battery.
Samsung's version of Android may eat up more RAM than other versions of Android as they have hooks in the ROM that will require it.
Is it normal if the consumption of ram is 1gb ??
Samsung has a lot of extra hooks and features in the ROM so it may not be that much out of the ordinary.

title: Sandisk MicroSD Card can't access on phone

thread.text:
I have a Galaxy S5 active and just bought a SanDisk 128gb microSDXC UHS-I Card with adapter for my phone. It says right on the front of the box that it's ideal for Android powered phones. When I put the SD card in my phone, I cannot access it and the phone won't allow me to see it. The only thing I can do is go into Settings/System/Storage/ and go to SD Card. From there if I click Mount SD Card it give me a thing that says'...
"SD Card Safe to Remove; You can Safely Remove SD Card"
It won't allow me to access the card's memory. I have inserted it into my computer and moved files on and off, so I know the card is good. What am I doing wrong? I've even tried to download a few different sd card apps from the Play Store with no success. It's really depressing having spent all that money on a card and it not working.

Is the SD Card formatted as FAT32 or ExFAT? If not, the phone won't be able to read it. 
When you insert it, do you see a notification pop up on your status bar? If you go to the My Files app (or File Manager, don't know what it's called on the S5 Active), do you see an External SD card or something similar there?

replies.text: It shows up on my PC as exFAT @ 128gb free space.

thread.text: Are you not able to see the card in the phone's File Manager? Does anything pop up on your phone when you connect it?

replies.text:
Well it's the Galaxy S5 Active so I have to connect it with the battery out, but if I open the back and slide the SD card out of the slot a little bit to unplug it then back in it tells me the following....
Preparing SD Card
Blank SD Card
SD card is blank or has unsupported file........
It then offers to format the SD card. If I choose to do that, it'll say "SD card safe to remove: You can safely remove SD card". Then nothing happens. If I go look for anything related to the card in Storage, I don't see anything. 
When I go into "My Files" then Local Storage only shows "Device Storage". If I go in there, I don't see anything related to an SD card.
When I go into Settings/System/Storage/SD Card, the only thing I see is the option "Mount SD Card". When I click on that it says "
"Total Space"
"Calculating"
"0.0B"
Then nothing else happens.

thread.text: Mmm... that's odd. Do you have any other microSD card you could try? I wonder if it's the 128GB that's throwing it off. I doubt it, since the S5 was able to use 128GB cards, but can't hurt to try.
I recommend formatting on your computer with the SD Card Associations software. https://www.sdcard.org/downloads/for.../eula_windows/

title: S5 Neo Bricked Corrupted EFS

thread.text: Help! My S5 neo g903f is Bricked after rooting. EFS invalid argument, stuck on blank screen after logo on booting. I've tried kies, smartsync, odin adb, twrp all to no avail. Any suggestions welcomed.

replies.text:
The /efs file is the unique file containing, among other things, your IMEI code and its loss or corruption renders your phone useless which is why, after rooting, you should make a backup of your /efs file and keep it somewhere safe on your PC or the cloud, or both. See, Getting to know your EFS folder on Samsung Devices
If, as per best practice, you have previously made a nandroid backup of your phone, there is a good chance that your custom recovery will have included your /efs file in the backup and you can restore it from the backup.

title: move to SD card

thread.text:
I added a 32GB SD card to my S5 Active, moved my pics to it, my problem is my phone still comes up and says it doesn't have enough space to do upgrades...can I move apps to the SD card and still be able to us them, and if so how do I move them?
Posted via the Android Central App

Most of what you move to the SD card is tiny pieces of the app - and leave a pointer to that piece in main storage, so you aren't saving a lot of memory - even if you move 10 apps, you won't gain much. Moving apps to the SD card is NOT a way of gaining storage. If 16GB isn't enough for the apps you need on your phone (just apps - everything else can go to the card), next time get a larger phone.

title: S5 Active failing to send messages - repeatedly

thread.text:
So I've had the issue a few random times before (maybe twice every 4-6 months, I've had the phone for 2 years now) where the stock messaging app will give me the 'failed to send'. I'll check the message center number, restart the phone, clear the cache, then ultimately do the switch-to-airplane-mode-and-switch-back fix, which always works, and I have no problems for another few months.
Today, this is the third time I've had to switch to airplane mode and back to get my phone to send messages. I can receive them just fine, but not get one through from my side. No major changes recently (software update was downloaded and installed ... 3 days ago, I think? with no issues). I've dropped the phone a few times but it's got a great protective case and everything else seems to be working fine.
Any reason I'd be seeing this multiple times in one day? Is there anything else I can try to get a more permanent fix?
Thanks for any help.
~Audrey

Have you tried it with a different messaging app? Though it's probably not the issue, worth a try. I use Textra exclusively on mine, way more customization than the stock app. I have had "sending failed" from time to time, but I never have to do anything to fix it, it's just a rare random occurence. Beyond that, maybe go into an AT&T store and ask them. If it's service related, you may have a bad SIM card. If it is SIM related, but due to a bad contact, you may be able to pull the card then reinstall it.

title: Major speakerphone problems

thread.text:
Constantly, the person on the other line cannot hear me. They have to hang up because they think I'm gone unless I take them off speakerphone. This is extremely annoying while in the car because I cannot take calls.
I already proved this issue inside an AT&T store and they replaced the device. A week later, I'm having the same troubles. It doesn't matter if I'm sitting home, on the road, or at work....90% of the time my speakerphone is useless.

I have this same problem with a new Galaxy S5 on Verizon. I had a Samsung rep guide me through the process of wiping the phone and starting over and it worked at first but by the end of the day no one could hear me on speaker phone again. The fact that it works at first and across different carriers suggests to me that it's a software issue. 
I haven't tried wiping it again and reloading apps one by one to see if it is an app conflict because I haven't had the time. I use my speakerphone a lot and if this can't be fixed it's a deal breaker.
I have not been able to fix this. I had the device replaced once already and still the problem continues.

In case anyone is following this, I sent my phone into Samsung under warranty (even tho I bought it via ebay from a private seller). They just sent me an email that they've replaced a part and are sending the phone back to me 2-day air. I have my fingers crossed that it's really fixed! This is what was in the email they sent:
Original Problem:
CALL QUALITY /SOUND - SOUND PROBLEMS - MICROPHONE NOT WORKING
Problem found:
TX AUDIO - MIC - TX AUDIO - MIC - LCD BLANK/SEG. MISSING/LINES
Solution:
REPLACED COMPONENT - REPLACED COSMETIC - REPLACED LCD

Again, in case anyone is following... the first time Samsung "fixed" my phone seemed to do nothing at all so I had to send it in again with the same complaint. Now the speaker seems to work 99% of the time so I'd say they solved it. The first time they switched out more parts though I can't tell what they were. 
So my advice is that if Samsung can't fix it the first time, send it back again because it is fixable.

I sent my Samsung galaxy note 5 in to Samsung they sent me a email saying this was work with my phone
Original Problem:
CALL QUALITY /SOUND - SOUND PROBLEMS - MICROPHONE NOT WORKING 
Problem found:

Hello all,

Welcome to Android Central! So just to be clear--you've tried different wall charging adapter plugs?

Hello,
The charger and the cable does matter. Pay attention to the V and A on the factory charger. Mine is 5.3v at 2amps. I have used other chargers and have seen poor results. The cable matters as well. It comes down to electronic theory. The length and thickness of the cable make a difference.

title: Pressing both Volume + and - buttons simotaneously

thread.text:
I found a flash light app that I really like. It allows the flashlight to be switched on even when the phone is locked, by pressing the Volume + and - at the same time.https://play.google.com/store/apps/d....torchie&hl=en
This is far more usable than the supplied widget which only works after unlocking the phone.
My only concern is, the +/- buttons are really one unit, more like a rocker. Should I be concerned with breaking it over time?

Hi Johnny, 
I don't think you should be concerned. IIRC there's actually nothing under the button in the middle. It's not really a 'rocker' underneath; it's two separate buttons covered by a single panel. If you push both buttons at the same time, the panel recedes completely instead of leaning towards one or the other volume selection. 
You can check to see if there's any noticeable bending on the 'rocker' when you press on both buttons. If there is, then there's something in the middle and that could be an issue, but still I don't think it'd be enough to break it.
Cool. Thanks.
Really hard not to think that was a sarcastic 'thanks' with that minion looking at me hehehehe
Cool. Thanks.

I try to wake the phone and call my landlord, and the screen will not come on. I've tried everything that I can possible find on Google. I've taken the battery out, I've held the power button, I've held the 3 combo buttons (home, power, and volume) and nothing. When I turn the phone on, it plays the normal jingle & shows "Samsung Galaxy S5 Active", but the screen is about half the size as normal, is green, and has lines running through it. All of the buttons on the phone work, as does the sound, and you can press the power button and see the home screen (again, green screen with lines) for about literally 1 second, and then it goes away. I have NO clue what is wrong. I called Samsung and they just said that I can send it in and fix it, but they seemed more concerned about the previous cracked screen than the current issue. title: Missing Storage Space and Potential Malicious Attack

thread.text:
2 weeks ago, I cleared 2 GB of storage from my phone because it was running out of memory. I haven't been taking photos, videos, or installing applications, yet I now only have 50 MB of storage left. I can't think of anywhere this 1.95 GB of free storage went.
Because of this, I suspected foul play and checked my application manager. I saw an application titled "tcpdumpService 1.0.14." From my knowledge of Computer Science, I know tcpdump is a packet analyzer used to collect and analyze all data transferred over a network. Is this application supposed to be installed on a Galaxy S5 Active? If not, is this a sign of a malicious hacker trying to steal my data? 
Between the storage space disappearing and seeing tcpdump, I'm concerned that I'm under attack. How would I look deeper into this to find out?
If you can believe this list Applications Safe to Remove - Pg. 18 | Samsung Galaxy Note 3 than tcpdumpservice is installed by default on Samsung (?) devices.

Okay, I talked to my network analyst friend and he said that the tcpdumpservice wasn't a cause for concern. That still leaves the question of where my 2 GB of data went. I looked at data usage and saw that on February 4th, the Android OS used 1.07 GB in background data!! What could the OS possibly use that much data for in a day? Something just doesn't seem right here.

replies.text: What, exactly, did you dump in the first place when you "cleared 2 GB of storage" from your phone? If you randomly dumped certain files, there is the chance that the OS simply restored them by re-downloading.

thread.text: A lot of storage can be taken by "Miscellaneous" - that's the data being saved by apps (like .ini files in a PC). Tell the app to remember your login, it gets saved there. Add credit cards to a "pay" app, they get saved there. Etc.

replies.text:
That's true. 
But, my PC days go back to the IBM PC/XT and PC/AT when they either didn't have hard drives at all or a 32 MB (note: megabytes, not gigabytes) hard drive was considered enormous (and enormously expensive). And that time 32MB hard drive still held tens of thousands of files, hundreds of "apps" and all their associated data.
The point is, you don't fill 1.5 - 2 GB of storage with things like "Tell the app to remember your login, it gets saved there. Add credit cards to a "pay" app, they get saved there. Etc."
No, there is something else going on here.

title: How do I fix my Galaxy S5 Active from nonstop turning on, reaching logo, and shutting off?

thread.text: A few days ago my phone would turn of and then kick on by itself, or sometimes I would have to power it on myself. I figured it may have been battery, but it wasn't the next day it would not turn on fully. Instead it would turn/vibrate on, reach the logo and shut off, continuously. I tried to reboot, but it just keeps doing the same over and over again. I heard it could have been the power button. I played with that for awhile, yet nothing has changed. Please if anyone can help with similar issues. I don't know what to do I'm just wanting to get my pictures at least off the phone. Any ideas?

Welcome to Android Central! Is there a reason why you don't think it's a battery issue? Have you tried a new or different battery as a test?
Also, try booting into Recovery and wipe the cache partition: http://support.t-mobile.com/docs/DOC-10404
Remove the battery and reinsert it, if it boots without you doing anything, the power button is stuck.

Vibration during boot can be a sign of water damage. If the phone was very cold (like being left outside all night in below zero weather), then brought into a warm environment, you get condensation inside the phone, which damages it.

title: I lost my pictures from my vacation! How can I get them back?

thread.text: Galaxy S5 active, all pic and videos saved to memory card. I recently traveled to Vegas, 2nd video from trip came up only as a black icon with an exclamation on it. Cannot view media apparently, and every video and picture after that. The camera would do what it's supposed to...take the pic, then I could see its thumbnail in bottom corner as normal. But nothing in the gallery. Just the same black icon/thumbnails. Removed battery, and memory card. Plugged it all back in and nothing. Gone! All black icons are gone. Help? 16gb phone, 64gb card.

Welcome to Android Central! The card might be defective, corrupt, or counterfeit. Install and run SD Insight to see if the card is genuine or counterfeit. Counterfeiters take a smaller card and program it to report that it's a larger card. Things work fine until you actually exceed the real storage limit--then files start corrupting.
If the card is genuine, it might still be corrupted. Unmount the card (in Settings>Storage), remove it, and insert it into your computer, then run chkdsk to look for bad sectors: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...d-sd-card.html

Your SD card has probably failed. This is not unusual, they're not terribly reliable. If you did not have a backup copy on a computer or cloud storage, then unfortunately the files are likely gone. Sorry. 
But even if they appear to be gone there's still a slight chance you may be able to recover them by putting the SD card in a laptop or PC with a card slot or USB card reader and using Recuva software: http://forums.androidcentral.com/e?l...token=C2kRzDkn 
From now on, remember: Backups, backups, backups!
B. Diddy had some good advice, but to increase your already slight chances of recovery, I recommend running Recuva before doing anything else.

title: Why has swype stop putting autospaces?

thread.text:
Swype no longer autospaces. space is selected in settings.
I have a fully updated galaxy s5 active.
Welcome to Android Central! Does that happen everywhere, or only in certain situations (like when entering text into an entry field on a browser page)?

I am having a similar issue. I just upgraded to 5.1.1 recently with my Galaxy S5 and I do have auto-spacing turned on. This happens everywhere that I attempt to type.
Before the update, after you swiped the last character of a word, you could let off the keyboard and immediately begin swiping the next word or choose an individual character.
After the update, after you swipe the last character of a word, the keyboard becomes temporarily unresponsive. All characters require two taps to appear. There is no haptic feedback on the first tap. Attempting to swipe a second word instead of choosing a specific character will only register the last letter of the word. "Hello there" appears as "Hello e", "What happened" appears as "What d", and "stupid thing" appears as "stupid g".

title: Emails won't clear from status bar after opened on desktop?

thread.text:
I have the Galaxy 5s that I love but for 1 year or more now (since I've had the phone) my work emails won't clear from the status bar when I open them on my desktop computer so I've got to swipe them away (or open) on my phone to clear them in status bar. This is my first samsung but on all of the LG's I've had they would clear when opened on computer. I use the email app (not gmail, not outlook) I think it might be the other/corporate email.
Any ideas?

Welcome to Android Central! Do you know if the email account uses a POP3 or IMAP server? Since POP3 actually downloads the emails from the server to the phone, reading them on the desktop won't do anything to the notification on the phone. IMAP syncs the phone with the server, so that ought to work. See more info here about POP3 vs IMAP: IMAP vs POP3
I'm not sure if this helps or but I asked and they said it's "autosync/exchange"

How long do you wait to see if the notifications go away? You might have to wait a few minutes, depending on how frequently the Email app syncs. The Gmail app is almost instantaneous, but I don't know how quick the Email app is.

Cleared phone cache (not just app cache)
Factory Reset (didn't even sign in with Google account)

title: Galaxy 5S going to Google on Home button press

thread.text: I noticed that many people are experiencing a similar problem with Galaxy 5S. Just got a replacement phone and with the new phone new problem appeared -- each time I pressed the home button, it automatically took me to Google. It was annoying, I had to use "back" button several times to get to home screen. After hours of searching online, and on my phone, I found the solution: In your Personalization menu --> go to Accessibility --> in Categories find Dexterity and interaciton --> under Interaction control make sure it is checked off as "on". I tried everything else and this finally worked. Now, now more going to Google when pressing Home button, it actually takes me to the home screen now. Hope this helps.

title: Why is my S5 Active randomly muting the sound when streaming through Bluetooth?

thread.text:
Recently my S5 Active has been randomly muting the sound when streaming through Bluetooth. The phone can be sitting on my desk at work or streaming in the car, and suddenly there is no sound. The audio keeps playing, and I can use the volume buttons to raise the volume back up, but it continues to plague me. The frequency of the problem has been occurring more often recently.
Bluetooth connections: Either the Motorola S305 the iSimple adapter in my car, and to a Sony SmartWatch 3. I have disconnected the watch, and it still continues, so that has been ruled out.
Programs: I have had it occur in both Google Music and Pandora
Android version: 5.0 (AT&T is annoyingly stingy on updates)
Occurs whether the phone is on a charger or not.
Has anyone else experienced this? Anyone know of a solution?

No, I haven't had this problem. But when I've had other strange problems with my Bluetooth devices, Unpairing and re-Pairing usually fixes the problem. Give it a try. But it is strange that your having issues with multiple devices at the same time though...
Otherwise, a factory reset may be required. I know... I hate doing that too! But it usually does clear up a lot of issues - especially battery drain issues!
Lastly, is your phone still under warranty? If nothing else works, try to get a replacement phone if it is.
Sent from my Samsung Galaxy S5 Active using the Tapatalk app

I'm having the same issue. Mine however is on an LG G4, and it's been happening to me in Spotify. 
As you describe, the BT volume drops to zero, while the music continues playing silently. 
I am using JBL E40BTs, and on Android 5.1

Notification can be shown on the lock screen by:Open SETTINGSSelect MY DEVICE tabSelect "Sounds and notifications"Scroll to the bottom of the screen and select "Notifications on lock screen"Select the appropriate setting 1) Show all content 2) Hide sensitive content or 3) Do not show notificationsA new notification bar will appear on the lock screen when notifications have arrived. Hope this helps.

1. Colors changed to garish white, yellow, etc. MUCH HARDER TO READ than the previous white text on black background for things like the notifications window. Can't find a way to change these back to something reasonable (like white on black).
2. Fonts and spacing have changed in the email app. I now get about 10 characters of the email subject (not enough to guess what it really is) and I get less emails on the screen at a time in the list view. It was already bad before but now it is basically unusable.
3. Can't tell if battery life is worse yet but it certainly doesn't seem to be noticeably better.
4. Still haven't fixed simple things like only having 3 items across, with giant gaps in between, in folder views (my old Samsung Rugged had 4 across on a smaller screen).
One bright light is that they moved the emergency call button onto the phone screen so you don't accidentally pocket-dial 911.

title: Ruggedizing my s5 active for motorcycle use

thread.text:
I use my s5 active on my dual sport motorcycle with no sim on airplane mode. Android apps are so far ahead of any of the GPS manufacturers it's comical, and you also have the obvious options of the Google play store for other "stuff". 
I use a chunky case on the phone. Can't remember the case, but it's tough and allows me to attach a tether so the phone doesn't fly off the ram finger mount. So mounting is covered. 
So far, the phone has proven to be 100% rain and mud proof. I've spent the last 3 weeks riding off-road throughout the Canadian maritimes. I feel confident that the phone will survive the weather as long as I keep the charging flap covered. 
I can use the phone no problem with motorcycle gloves.
Problems
1)vibration. 
i ride a big single cylinder bike that vibrates through the bars quite a bit. I'm concerned that I'm going to kill the phone with vibration. I've got some ideas on more rubber damping on the Mount, but still... When I touch the phone while riding, it is vibrating quite a bit. Problem?
2) charging. 
It charges fine while riding. Like above, I'm concerned that the vibration is going to kill the charging port. I'm considering a spare battery that charges in my tank bag and just swap them out, but that just seems like a lot of rigamarole. Is there such a thing as a cable that locks in hard to reduce vibration? 
I guess that's it. Charging and vibration are the final pieces to the puzzle. If anyone is interested, locus pro is an unbelievably powerful GPS app. It is "The One".
Cheers
Sent from my D5803 using Tapatalk

Do you ever unplug it, or just leave it plugged in all of the time? If you leave the cord attached all of the time, I'd just dab some clear silicone around all sides of it and call it a day. Silicone is obviously waterproof, so as long as you get complete coverage, you're golden. And once it dries it's definitely strong enough to hold the cord in there, short of you accidentally snagging it in some manner. (zip ties could potentially help remedy that though.)
Another option (albeit a slightly more extreme one) could be to remotely mount the battery elsewhere and run a wire to the phone. I'm not sure if you'd be able to solder to the normal contacts that are exposed in the battery slot (for whatever reason, I'm leaning towards guessing that the answer to that is No.), so you'd have to open it up and solder inside or get otherwise creative... I don't know if that's even a viable idea, but just thought I'd plant the seed...
As for vibration, if you mount the phone to any surface on the bike, you're going to get a hell of a lot of vibration regardless of rubber damping. You need to create some sort of seperation... and as I'm typing this, I just got a goofy-*** idea, but it just might work: How about a balloon? What if you got a small balloon, only blew a little bit of air into it, and put that behind the phone? It would flatten out and conform to whatever shape is behind it, but it would create a soft spot for the phone to lay against. Then use some Saran Wrap, folded lengthwise, to wrap around the phone and the bike frame / tank / whatever...?? That would be some straight up MacGuiver shiznit right there! lol
Good luck! Cheers!

title: How can I get my AT&T S5 Active on Straight Talk to send and receive MMS?

thread.text: I Got a AT&T Galaxy S5 active model # SM-G870a not unlocked running android 4.4.4. Everything works but the mms. 4g lte all works but can't send or receive mms. Tried all kinds of APNs but nothing. I have a AT&T straight talk sim installed in it. Please someone help me.
worked it out had to use go sms which if fine.
I having the same problem how do I fix it

Ive had the same problem before. Heres how to fix it.Go to settings network connections look for more networks then go to Mobile networks Access Point Names. Make sure in the APN type you have the following default,hipri,mms,supl,tfdata,admin,fota does not have to be in that order but make sure it contains mms and hipri for sure and supl. I hope this works. I joined just so I could reply to tell you this. Let me know. If not i will figure it out. I have a galaxy s5 at&t but using straight talks att sim and everything works great.

You should be able to choose one of the 2 pre-installed straight talk settings. If one doesn't work then try the other. You may also need to reboot the phone after changing over. Also it's important to hit the save button on the top right after picking an apn setting. 
Sent from my SAMSUNG-SM-G870A using Xparent BlueTapatalk 2

Report back either way to let us know the out come, but it seemed to cure my S5A ills.

thread.text: I did the "hard reboot" by removing the battery for a couple of minutes. That resolved the issue of pressing the home button and ending up in Google Now. Many of you are likely not old enough to remember the really early DOS computer days. Whenever a program was installed you had to do a hard reboot to get everything working after the install. Later on a restart became adequate but if that didn't do the job the old power down trick generally got things going again. If you didn't power down, the update would not actually install and just sat in memory until the computer was powered down to activate it. Hope those days are not returning, but it appears at least it worked this time. If you are still having problems try it and see if it will get you back into action. It can't hurt anything to try.

I had to go to Google settings and disable Google Now. You can find Google in the App drawer. Still had to reset the phone to make the Home button go back to normal, it kept trying to open Google Search until I did the reset.
